summary: A character reference letter from Kevin Maxwell to Judge Alison J. Nathan in support of his sister Ghislaine Maxwell's bail request. Kevin portrays Ghislaine as honest, law-abiding, and family-oriented, and offers to co-sign a substantial bond secured by family property.

persons.name: Kevin Maxwell
persons.role: Character witness, brother of Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Author of the letter; an entrepreneur who describes his close relationship with his sister Ghislaine, vouches for her character, and offers to co-sign her bail bond.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the letter; Kevin's younger sister who is facing charges and seeking release on bail. Kevin asserts her honesty, organization, and commitment to facing the legal process.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The recipient of the letter; the judge presiding over Ghislaine Maxwell's case in the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'the late Jeffrey Epstein' in relation to the charges that Ghislaine Maxwell remained in the US to address.

persons.name: Pandora Maxwell
persons.context: Kevin's ex-wife whose properties would be used to secure the proposed $3.5 million bail bond for Ghislaine.

connections.description: Siblings; Kevin describes them as the nearest in age and very close, with him acting as one of her closest confidants and advisors.
Ex-spouses; Kevin states he is offering to co-sign a bond secured by properties owned by his ex-wife Pandora.
Implied association through reference to 'charges against the late Jeffrey Epstein' which Ghislaine remained in the US to address.
Connection through Kevin; Pandora's judgment of Ghislaine's integrity is cited as a reason for securing the bond with her property.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested, as referenced by Kevin Maxwell stating communication ceased 'up until her arrest on July 2nd 2020'.

events.title: Bail Request Submission
events.description: Kevin Maxwell submits this character reference letter to Judge Nathan in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's request for bail.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Kevin Maxwell, Ghislaine's brother, offers to co-sign a $3.5 million bail bond secured by properties owned by his ex-wife, Pandora Maxwell.
Kevin asserts that Ghislaine remained in the US jurisdiction to be available to address civil or criminal allegations related to Jeffrey Epstein.
Kevin states Ghislaine has never before been involved in any allegation of breaking the law and describes her as 'absolutely straight, clear and honest'.
The letter claims Ghislaine provided evidence under oath in a civil deposition, which Kevin cites as an illustration of her candor.
Kevin describes a close, confidant relationship with Ghislaine, with regular communication until her arrest on July 2, 2020.
